intro: Colobium tripolitanum, commonly known as the Tripoli spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are alternate and often have a rough texture, while its flowers are clustered in umbels. Colobium tripolitanum is valued for its resilience and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
